alert.note: Alert for Chelan (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 28 at 6:05AM PDT until June 29 at 2:30PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...The Flood Watch is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Stehekin River at Stehekin affecting Chelan County. For the Stehekin River...including Stehekin...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Stehekin River at Stehekin. * WHEN...From this evening to early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, The river may be out of its banks in spots on parts of Stehekin Valley Road and Company Creek Road, especially from Harlequin Bridge to about seven miles upstream. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:30 AM PDT Tuesday the stage was 23.3 feet. - Forecast...The Stehekin River may briefly touch the Flood Stage of 24 feet Tuesday evening for a short period of time before lowering below 24 feet by Wednesday morning. It is then expected to remain near 23 feet through the week. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (5 am PDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri Stehekin River Stehekin 24.0 23.3 Tue 4 am PDT 23.9 22.8 22.4 &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 500 PM PDT.
